No he doesn't! And I don't either!
Blimey! She hasn't sparkled like this since boot camp! Carry on boys.
Impressive indeed. Just keep your grubby little hands to your side.
You got it, Squidward. Finally I have a clean place to store my toothbrush.
Just don't touch my clarinet!
I promise nothing untoward will happen.
Order up, SpongeBob!
SpongeBob! What do you think you're doing? You're supposed to be fry cooking. I told you not to touch my stuff!
I didn't! I wore protective gloves! And besides, don't you like how classy it look now?
Velvet..
Now I'd like to stand by and idly chat with you, Squidward, But I must attend to my Krusty Krab duties! In the future, please keep your interruptions to a minimum sir, please!
And here's your change, mam.
What is that idiot doing now?!
Loose change!
I hope you're not trying to shove the boxes into that locker!
Too late! it's already done.
If you smashed my clarinet-- so help me, Neptune-- I will
Don't worry Squidward there's plenty of room!
I... expanded a bit.
Well it's all fine and dandy, but where's my clarinet?
Well, that's simple
We just simply consult the card catalog and find.. Squidward's Clarinet drawer 36●8-B
See?
Fine. but remember, It's vitally important that nothing happens to it
Don't worry buddy!
You're in good hands.
What's he doing?!
May I order please?
Alright what do you want?
I'll Have-
Is everything OK back there?
Yeah, Just a bit of a... renovation.
My clarinet! SpongeBob!
SpongeBob?
There. 36●8-B
a note?!
Item has temporarily moved during reconstruction. Relocated to shelf 1018●2-E.
SpongeBob?!
Another note?!
Oops! Did I say 1018●2-E? I meant 2019●3-F! Sorry!
SpongeBob?! SpongeBob?!
SpongeBob, Wait!
What have you done to my-
SpongeBob I do not play games.
Where am I? What is this place?
Hey, come back! I need my clarinet! Come Back! Where are you? Sponge-
I am the keeper of the horned forest, state your business here.
uuhh.. I'm.. trying to find my clarinet.
Your clarinet?
Yes, my clarinet! Which I am the proud owner.
A clarinet is not owned. Why don't you tell me why you're really here?
You calling me a liar?!
I don't appreciate your tone.
I'm sorry I-I-I didn't mean to offend you.
This is a sacred place where clarinets live without persecution. You need to learn respect.
I've learned..  I've learned respect...
I don't believe you.
Stand still you idiot!
I got you now!
ha ha! Wha the- SpongeBob? SpongeBob?!
I win! I win!
Hey.. What are you doing here?
You tell me what in the wide world of sports is this place? And how did you get so big?
Must be all the pressure.
What are talking about?
It must be... The pressure.
I gotta get outta here!
Where are you going you imbecile?!
Almost... Gotcha!
I just sweet talked an old lady out of $20 for a Krabby Patty!
Squidward, are you okay?
-Such a nightmare!
Squidward, what are you trying to say buddy?
I tried to get my clarinet in there...  Impossible!
Clari-- Oh! You mean this!
Where did you get that?!
Well, with all the ruckus you were making over it, I kept it with me, Just to make sure it was safe.
Grrr...
Call it a friendly gesture!
I'll show you a friendly gesture! Do you know the horror I've endured?!  Let's see how you like it!
Ahh!
Are you ready, Mr. Squidward?
Yes, yes I am; as a matter of fact, you wouldn't believe what I had to go through to get-
Hi, Squidward! You wouldn't believe what I had to go through to get here.
Hmm.. I was just going to bring his clarinet.
Just two more minutes, Patrick.
Yup!
Look! Here he comes!
Who?
Thank you, Mr. Ranger.
Yeah, thanks.
Yes?
Aren't you forgetting something?
Yeah, something.
Please show me your--  jellyfishing licenses.
Patrick, look! I caught a rare breed a glowing three-spot.
Hey, I caught one, too! This one's a five-spot.
Patrick, guess what?
You like it here so much, you feel yourself being moved to a song?
Yes, yes, how did you guess?
Well, I kinda feel the movement coming on myself.
Let's just start with the song.
You mean "The Jellyfishing Song"?
That's the one.
♪Jelly lelly lelly lelly, jelly lelly lelly jelly, its the jellyfishing song!♪ ♪Jelly lelly lelly lelly, jelly lelly lelly jelly, everybody sing along!♪ ♪I go jellyfishing in da' morn'in,♪
♪I jellyfish all da' night!♪
♪I jellyfish all da' afternoon,♪
♪Jellyfishing make me feel all right!♪
♪Everybody singgggggggggggggggg♪
♪Everybody sing along!♪
Isn't it great that these majestic creatures have Jellyfish Fields to call their home?
You bet! And it's highway convenient, too, according to that big sign!
Big sign? I didn't see a big sig-Jumping Jellyfish! That's a big sign!
It says, "Future site of the Shelly Super Highway."
Superhighway!!!!!???? Do you know what this means??!!
Well, its sorta like other roads, except there's no sto-
I know what a superhighway is! I mean for all this jellyfish! For us! For Jellyfish Fiel--ds, uh, sorry.

So what you're saying is, that if they go though with their plans, to build this new superhighway through Jellyfish Fields, that every single specie of flora & fauna that makes this place their habitat will be forced out of the ecosystem that they have formed, effectively being destroyed?
Well, yeah, that's a simplified version, but yeah, something like that  which is why I hereby make this solemn vow to stop this so-called, "Shelly Super Highway," from ever being built!
Larry, you gotta help me stop the highway!
Can't right now, bro. I got about 4,098 more reps to do.
Mermaid Man! Barnacle Boy! Certainly with superpowers like yours, we can stop this superhighway!  Hmmm.
I'm sorry, SpongeBob. I actually would like to help, but I'm just too busy right now.
Too busy doing what?
I'm too busy telling you, "No!"
Private SpongeBob! Ahoy!
Captain Mr. Krabs, ahoy.
Why, SpongeBob, That's not your usual four-fingered salute.
Well, I guess I'm just upset because they're building a highway over Jellyfish Fields.
Well, SpongeBob, I'd sure hate me customers to see you like this. Is there anything I can do to help?
Really, Mr. Krabs?
Sure, why not?
Oh, Mr. Krabs! I just know that together, we can stop that nasty old highway from going right through Jellyfish Fields!
Uh, you're not talking about the Shelly Superhighway, are ya?
Yeah, why?
Uh, well, 'cause I'm actually in favor of that highway being built.
Yes! I've already calculated how many new customers I'll get once it's finished. You can see fo yourself in this series of these charts and diagrams I have displayed!

Charts and dia- Mr. Krabs! Didn't you see!?  After the Shelly Superhighway goes right through Jellyfish Fields, it goes right over the Krusty Krab! Gee, there you are, decrepit and living in a cardboard box! Then, it does a loop-de-loop for some reason, and goes right through the front door of the Chum Bucket!
What!!?? Who approved this plan!!??
"Plan approved by & sponsored by Sheldon J. Plankton Enterprises, a division of No Fun Incorporated!"
C'mon, boy! Let's you and I go over and show that Plankton a piece of our minds!
Think this piece will get the point across?
Alright, Plankton! It's Eugene Krabs, here, with, What's-His-Name! Now c'mon out!
I can't.
C'mon outside, and take what's coming to ya!
I really can't come outside!
Why not!?
Because I'm already outside, you bumbling barnacles! Open your eyes for cryin' out loud!
Oh, sorry.
Now what's this all about, anyway?
Don't play coy with us, Shelly. We both know you've been up to no good. Now start talking.
All right, so I've been stealing your mail for the past five years, big whoop.
Not that!
What? You've been what?

We're talking about that new superhighway you're planning on building, and in case you didn't know, it's gonna destroy Jellyfish Fields. Not to mention that your plan is stupid and dumb and dumb and stupid.
Wait a minute. You've been what?
Well, that certainly was an interesting series of words that just tumbled out past your teeth and lips, but frankly, my dear sponge, I don't give a barnacle.
Huh?
I don't know.
Forget it. Even if I wanted to the Shelly Superhighway from being built, it would be impossible.
Why?
Because the whole city has already approved it! See for yourself, through this conveniently-timed flashback.
Order. Order. Order in the Meeting Hall.  Now all those in favor of paving over Jellyfish Fields and building the Shelly Superhighway, raise your right fin and say "aye."
Aye!
I like highways.
I like things that are super.
And I like saying, "aye."
Oh, why did I say "aye"?
Seems as though the ayes have it. Now if you'll excuse me, I've got superhighway preparations to be attending to. Toodles!
What are we gonna do now, Mr. Krabs?
Well, I'm gonna do the only thing I can do when me character is tested by insurmountable odds lie on me back and sob loudly.
Normally, Mr. Krabs, I would lie on my back and sob loudly too, but I am not giving up! There's still one citizen in Bikini Bottom who won't sit still in the face on this outrageous injustice!

♪Chum Bucket, sludge bucket, highway fly away! Lilly liver, pizza giver, mashed potato, kelp tomato!♪ ♪All we are trying to say, is give Jellyfish Fields a chance!♪ ♪Ketchup bottle, net and goggle, tollbooth, rotten tooth, freeway plan, toast and jam, Mermaid Man, a garbage can! Citrus fruit, combat boot, give a hoot, gorilla suit!♪ ♪All we are trying to say is give Jellyfish Fields a chance!♪ ♪Plankton's eye, ham on rye! Larry's thigh, battle cry! ketchup squirt, long-sleeved shirt! Self assert,♪ ♪Hit the Dirt! Krusty Krab, smash and grab! Barg 'N' Mart! Grocery cart!♪ ♪All we are trying to say, is give Jellyfish fields a chance!♪ ♪C.E.O's! Gary's toes! Squidward's nose! Pantyhose! Rocking chair, wash and wear! Empty stare, Patrick's hair! Green trees, Sandy's fleas! Rise and shine, lemon lime! Out of time, squiggly line!♪ ♪Take a stand, hand in hand. All we are trying to say, is give Jellyfish Fields,♪ ♪a chance.♪  It's working, Patrick! They're booing the highway! Looks like our message has really gotten through to the people! Let's play a song while their hearts are open!  Hey, wait a minute. This is one of our fliers! They're pelting us with our own pamphlets!  what does this mean!
I, couldn't tell you.
I'll tell you what it means! It means this!
It means, you hate tambourines?
No! It means-
Alright, you guys the highway haters?
Yes, sir, but with good reason. You see, without Jellyfish Fields, jellyfish will have to find a new home and-
Alright, you two. You're under arrest!
What for?
Unlicensed use of a sitar!
But, my grandma gave me this sitar! It didn't come with a license.
Yeah, well, neither did this!
Patrick, I'm scared!
SpongeBob, I'll never forget what my great-Uncle Cletus said right before he was arrested during a freedom march.
What was that?
Oh, it's when a bunch of people go walkin' on a street, an-
I know what a freedom march is, Patrick! I mean, what did he say?
Oh, . He said, "Let not your heart walk away from you, lest your mind grow legs and follow it."
Wow. Your uncle sounds like a pretty smart guy, Patrick! What happened after he was arrested?
I don't know, because no one one ever heard from him again.
See ya later, longhairs!
Bye!
See you later!
It's a wig!
Thanks for the lift!
They left us, out here in the middle of nowhere!
Oh, this isn't the middle of nowhere; We're actually on the edge of nowhere!
Well, at least it ain't raining!
I'm not ready to give up just yet!
I am!
If we could just come up with a better way to reach the people, something everyone can see and hear!
You mean like a parade?
Oh, a parade! Patrick, how did you come up with such a brilliant idea?

There's one going by right there. [shows two fish with a banner saying "Shelly Super Highway"; followed by a marching band; followed by a float and the circus; followed by Santa on a tropical island on a limo; followed by a herd of senior citizens being whipped at by the two wrestlers from Krusty Krushers; followed by a group of Scottish fish playing bagpipes; followed by some clown fish and a cat parade balloon; followed by a choir; and finally followed by a heavy metal rock band.
That certainly is a parade!
Look!
Plankton! Driving a big tractor! This doesn't look good at all, Patrick.
Does this?!
C'mon! Let's go follow them!

People of Bikini Bottom- Today marks the new- STOP MURMURING!!  Thank you. And as I was saying, today marks the beginning of a new-   Shut up!  As I was saying, today marks a new beginning for Bikini Bottom!  Now, its time to pave our way down the road to success!  Ah, I love the smell of hot tar in the morning! Yeah, baby!  Hey, you there! are you trying to get yourself crushed!?
I won't let you do it, Plankton! If you're going to pave over Jellyfish Fields, you're going to have to pave over me first!
Well, then; Your wish is my command, Sponge!
Is that all you got?
Knock it off, Patrick.
I used to dream of me restaurant with "easy highway access!"
Yeah, but this is more like "highway excess!"
Well, I'm going to go soak my tentacles.  It's cold in here underneath all of this concrete!
But Squidward, you can't leave! What if we have, a customer?
Really. We haven't had a customer since the day this highway was built!
Well, actually, Squidward, it's called a super-highway.
I don't care what it is! I'm out of here!
But Squidward-
No, SpongeBob. Squidward's right.  It's high time we started accepting facts.
I'm on it, Mr. Krabs!
No, boyo! Not that kind!
Mr. Krabs, what are you saying?
The Krusty Krab can't stay in business. Not like this.
It can't?
No, SpongeBob. And its time to activate Plan Zed-9er9er.
Zed-9er9er!!!???
Eugene, what is Zed-9er9er!!?? And more importantly, how does it affect me!?
Plan Zed-9er9er is, I'm- I'm- I'm selling the Krabby Patty secret formula to Plantkon!
Eugene!
I have no choice. And stop calling me Eugene.
Tell me I'm dreaming!
Not this time, little fella.
Uh lower, a little lower, yeah, that's it!  Now who could that be during my hour of triumph?  How appropriate.
Plankton, I'm ready to negoitiate a price for me secret formula.
Oh sure!  Let me just wind my watch!
What for?
Cause I'm gonna love every minute of this!  Did you hear that?
What?
Karen, is that you??
Up there!  Whoa, nelly!!!
First, I lost Jellyfish fields, and- and......
And what?
And now I lost the only job I ever wanted!
Look on the bright side, at least I don't have to put up with you anymore! Ha,ha! This could be the start of something beautiful! OW! What the-!
Look! All the jellyfish who used to live in Jellyfish Fields are coming to Bikini Bottom!
Yeah, but for some reason, I don't think they're here to trade gift baskets!
Aw, ya don't?
You know something, Plankton? Maybe we can talk about this later. I think I'm just gonna run for me life.
Wait! I'm coming with you!  No!  Not the eye! Not the eye!!

Chaos runs rampage in Bikini Bottom.  That's right folks, this is news reporter, Ben Blenny standing in for Perch Perkins who's out today with a terrible case of indigestion and we are coming to you live during day 3 of what appears to be Bikini Bottom's worst-
Am I on television?
Yes sir, you are, would you care to say a few words about the-
Hi Mom, hi Dad. Hey Dr. Slieen.  Hey Jennifer, hey Sally, hey Francis, hey Mable,  hey Julie, hey Abigail.
Ah! Now they'll have to listen!
And there's my friends in El Tuna, and the gang at the Pudgy Flipper...
Uh, thank you.  Hello little boy, about saying a few words into the camera about the current crisis?
Well okay, I guess, sorry I am a little nervous.
That's understandable, just speak loud and clear.

Well all I have to say is that um, well,  Stop the madness! We need to get Jellyfish Fields back to the jellyfish, which will restore their natural habitat so they will be in peace. So what do you say everybody, will you help me?
No!
You're kidding, right?
Yes!
All right everyone, say goodbye to the worst thing that's happened to Bikini Bottom since those 99 cent stores.
Yeah!
Good effort, SpongeFool, but you can't destroy my highway, it's indestructable!
Not if we have something to do with it!
Larry Lobster!
That's right, pal, but that's not all.
Sandy Squirrel!
Mrs. Puff!
Mermaid Man & Barnacle Boy!
Patrick!
Su-Su-Su-Super!
And Squidward!
Nope, that's everybody!
Now Push!
Harder!
Still harder!
You heard that little square guy, go!
Wait! I didn't count on all of you working together!
My highway! Stop, you can't do this!
Yeah!
Praise Neptune.
Jelly lelly lelly leely, jelly lelly lelly jelly, it's the jelly fishing song!
Clap!
Jelly lelly lelly lelly, jelly lelly lelly jelly, everyone sing along!
Clap!
Jelly lelly lelly leely, jelly lelly lelly jelly, it's the jelly fishing song!
Clap!
Jelly lelly lelly leely, jelly lelly lelly jelly everyone siiiiiiiiiiiiiiinnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnggggggggg!
Everyone sing along.
Oh boy Jellyfishing, I can’t wait! Can you Patrick?  Patrick? Patrick?
Did you say something?
I said...  Ow!
I’m sure how to respond to that.
Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy!
Hey we’re stuck here remember?
Why is that?
Because you forgot to fill up the boat mobile before we left. See?
Hey heroes! Is there anything we can do?  So is that it?
Yes. Thank you boys we don’t usually do this but in term for pushing the invisiboat of those hills. There’s something I'd like you to see, but you must promise to not touch anything.
Okay!  Wow!
Oh the magic clock from episode 1582! Man Ray’s power glove.
A pair of binoculars.
Yes boys, this is our locker of memories. It contains uh... Uh... I can’t remember.
It contains all the member billion up from our super human adventures.
Wow. Hey SpongeBob, check it out!
The Dirty Bubble's bubble wand!
Correct!
Scared boys?
Mmm-hmm.
Well don't be.
And as long as no one touches anything there's nothing here to be scared of.
Understood.
And this is our time machine. This device allows us to transport into the future or past at a date or destination of our choosing.
Ooo!
Unfortunately, the consequences of altering the order of history are so dangerous; we chose it to leave it alone so you mustn’t touch...
Hey the snack machine took my quarter! I want my crunchy munchities!
No!
Stupid box!  We really gotta get that thing fixed.
You fool! You realized what you’ve done?!
Well I lost a quarter.

column1: SpongeBob 1, Patrick 1, Mermaid Man, and Barnacle Boy

column2: Oh where are we?  It can’t be! Bikini Bottom has at least 39 people living here!

Maybe as you knew it, but this is a different Bikini Bottom of another time. Maybe if they've hadn’t touched the time machine like we told you Patrick, we wouldn’t be in this mess! Hopefully we hadn’t changed anything with our presence.
Oh! Everything looks so fashioned.
I’m ready to rule the world and its riches!

column1: With this weapon, nothing can stop me!

column2: That’s what you think.
Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy?!
Sorry, Man Ray. But by stolward companion Barnacle Boy and I they took different with you.
You tangled with the wrong fishhook with justice Man Ray.
Now prepare for a heavening help with quick dry tartar sauce.
Wow our bodies are so tight.
What went wrong?
Jumpin' Jellyfish, what happened to the tartar sauce?
Good thing that was around. I was starving.
This is creeping me out!
Well but Patrick what about Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy?
Well I don’t got time for that!
Where are you going boys?
I just want to go home!
When are we going to have those two classified as villains?
They left us here! What are we going to do? I’m sure it’ll all work out.
Don’t worry Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy are always here to help the elderly. There’s something familiar about these two Barnacle Boy... I just can’t remember. I just can’t put my flipper on it.
Hey neat hat!
Thanks I... uh...
Let’s get these poor defenseless saviors out of harm’s way.
Well, that’s more like it. making good old present day Bikini Bottom.
Yes Patrick we were all born in our places of time. Hello fellas citizen. Hello Squilliam.
Man Ray is great.
Yeah. Must be taking care of his oppugations.
Well That Oughta Teach Him To Jaywalk.
I uh Patrick do you notice anything different about our prison.
Sorry I couldn’t hear you over the clatter of prison chains.
I said is there something odd about Bikini Bottom since we got back.
No. But yes! Just look at the giant medicine billboard! It’s missing a bolt on the bottom right corner!
Even worse than that Patrick. The police got new uniforms!
Oh no! What did they do with those old ones?!
Ah ye! What happened to the Krusty Krab?!  The designed area where you are permitted by Man Ray, your ruler, to obtain sandwiches using Man Ray dollars? The city under life, tradity, and all this.
I’m out of Man Ray dollars?
No Patrick it means we somehow changed the course of history when we went to the past well, in this reality Man Ray is ruler. Oh we got to do something.
For what?
One of these suspecting citizens of the Free World that do in a time crisis. See if I still have a job!
Hey you’re not eating fast enough!
Excuse me, Squidw...
Yes?
Barnacle Boy? What are you doing here?
I’m just taking stuff in a wasted life.
Order up!
Mermaid Man is wearing a hairnet! What happened? Why are the two greatest heroes ever stuck in this greasy spoon not combating the evils of Man Ray?
I lost a desire and enough physique to fight long ago kid. Flipping patties is so much easier on the joints when you’re my age.
What about the younger "Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy"? Surely they refuse to surrender without a fight.
You got spaghetti for brain's kid? We are the younger ones. The older ones  lost our souls and buried in this very restaurant.
I’m so sorry for your loss of yourself.
I hate to break up the memorial service but we’re out of tartar sauce out here.
Tartar Sauce?! The topping that destroyed life as we knew it! If only my tartar sauce attack hadn’t failed that day, we wouldn’t be living in this wasteland! We’re already out?
Yep. It’s chewy that’s...
I knew I recognized you from somewhere and you ate that tartar sauce on that day! You realized what you’ve done?!
Sorry Mermaid Man we didn’t mean to destroy your lives you held dear. What do we say to try to make things right? With your help of course.
I’m not teaming up with you to do jack diddly squat! Besides, Man Ray had to buy the neck! O-E! Evil.
Does that mean the defeat was so traumatic that it has given Man Ray a stranglehold on your psyche?
Barnacle... No! It means he put the electrical collar on me that won’t allow me to leave the restaurant!
Oh, let’s get the nasty thing off of you.
Haven't you two idiots have done enough damage already??
I can’t get a good grip on it! I must need a better angle. Sorry sorry. Hey, Patrick can you give me a hand on here?
Keep away from me!
Ta-daaa! You're free! Now can we coax you and Barnacle Boy out of retirement to save the new universe?
I suppose you’ve proven your medal but, I’ll have my eye on you two. Now let’s pop that Dirty Bubble!
Actually we’re fighting Man Ray.
Well in that case let the light house of justice shine on Ray Man!
Okay I suppose that’s close enough. Back to the past gents, to stop you from eating the tartar sauce again for the first time.

column1: The First SpongeBob, Patrick, Mermaid Man, and Barnacle Boy

column2: I am ready to rule the world and its riches!
Not so fast Man Ray!
We’ve got a little surprise for you.
Keep your tongue out of the tartar sauce!
Impostors!
Who are you calling impostors, impostor? I must prevent our tartar sauce from being eaten by that fool!
If I want my tartar sauce I have to go through me first!
I’ll make you eat those words!
Bring it.  Take this!  I’ll never let you win.
Oh yes I will.
What do you make of this?
Tangled timeline Mermaid Man.
You old coops provided me the perfect distraction. Now prepare to be disappeared!
Sounds good on paper you purveyor of evil but fortunately we all know what happens to paper underwater. Barnacle Boy the tartar sauce.
I’ve really eaten that much tartar sauce.
Yes you have.
Well it sure ain't sittin right.
Foolish mools. Once Again moble foolery has given victory!   Oh I want to save for this. It’s not every day I get to defeat Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy 3 times over.
Patrick don’t eat the tartar sauce!
You’re too late! Your fat friend beat you to it. Now prepare to taste the laser!  So how...
I told you we had to go back farther!
Uh...
Up, up, and away!
Now Patrick!
I can’t get my head around this. Where are they all coming from?  Another machine?
I took care of your blasted time machine!
Uh! I got to sit down and think this through.
Gotta! You’ve got plenty of time for thinking in the stony lonesome.
I’m sorry, did you say something? I’m still trying to comprehend what just happened here.
It’s pretty simple really. You were defeated by a Conroy of time cruising crime stoppers. Thank you SpongeBob and Patrick.
You’re Welcome!
Oh hi there! Hello! Hello! Hello!
We just wanted to come back and revisit the day that evil was defeated forever.
Hey, how you doing?
We’re here.

column1: Eighth and Ninth SpongeBobs and Patricks
column2: Oh hi there! How you doing?
Hello! Hello!
Oh hi there!  Hello! Hello!
Patrick! Guess what came in the mail today!
Oh! What?!
This...
Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy lost episode! Stick it in!
Gagagaga!
Faster then light! Prepared to stop crime! It's Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy!
Yeah!
If you're in a jam, It's Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy!
The Adventures of Mermaid Man And Barnacle Boy! Tonight's episode The Secret Meeting!  Deep in the Mercave, something strange takes Mermaid Man's attention!
The Dirty Bubble? What's he doing at the bus stop?
Looks like he's got a one-way ticket to Bikini Bottom, and there's only one thing he could be up to in Bikini Bottom, Barnacle Boy!
That's right, Mermaid Man!
Evil!
Haherhaherherherher!
The Terrible Man Ray!
Hm, so glad you could make it!
I wouldn't miss this for the world, Dirty! Hahahahah.

The most Powerful Of All crustaceans, it's Jumbo Shrimp! Its the Atomic Flounder! The abomination of a nuclear experiment gone horribly wrong! And the terror of the sewers, the man eating Sinister Slug!
We join Forces at last.
It's worse than i could have imagined! A team up!
Welcome to the BGATFBC!
Muhahahahahahahha!
April third, 12 of noon! That's tomorrow!
Holy...
Hey!
Hehehe! Don't worry! I can fix it!  Deeae!
Great Guppies, Mermaid Man! We gotta do something!
Not so fast, little flipper! We are far too out-manned! But fear not. We are always one step ahead of evil!
Our Hero of the bride puts up a call!
To the ocean's greatest heroes!
Yeah, I can hold.
Meanwhile, a sinister horde congregates outside Hotel Evil!
Right this way, gentlemen!
Hey, what's going on in here?
Huh? Oh, I'm dreadfully sorry, gentlemen, you must be in the wrong room! This room is reserved for the B.G.A.T.F.B.C.
That's funny. I thought it was aside for the I.J.L.S.A.
I.J.L.S.A? What in coral caverns is that?
Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy!
That's right!  Now, before you have to say goodbye, say hello to some friends!  The Elastic Wasteband!
Greet the hottest crime fighter in the country!  Professor Magma!
The illusive Miss Appear!  And The Pi-Right Ponderer with his hairnet of knowledge!
Do we really exist?
Together, we are The International Justice League Of Super Acquaintances!
Let's Get em boys!
Do not tussle with the B.G.A.T.F.B.C!
Violence resolves nothing.
Good night, balloon boy!
Professor Magma! Catch!
Step aside, you copious cod! My beef is with the bubble!
Careful Barnacle Boy! He's got Nuclear Touch!
Raaaa!
Nuclear Touch!
Aaahh!
I Can't watch!
Fracturing furniture! Hang tight buddy!
Hang in there, my daring deputy.
Your daring deputy is nothing right now! But I'd be happy to pass along out the message! If he ever wakes up that is!
Swirling Shrimp! That fiend has taken control over Barnacle Boy!
What do we do, Mermaid Man?

I'm glad you asked!  I believe that if The Atomic Flounder were to touch that wretched growth, it would cause a chain reaction, reversing the polarity, and the molecular level, restoring Barnacle Boy to his natural state!!

column1: Does that sound about right, Professor Magma?

column2: You'll never do it! You don't have the moxie!
That's what you think, curd!  Shield!  Ha, Ha, Ha!
Look out, Mermaid Man!
Grrrr!
Yay!
The Sinister Slug's slime has got you stationary and stiff! Which means, your time is up, Hand!
Not Nuclear Touch!
Great Gravy! What just happened?
I'll tell you about it later, now let's take out the trash!
Please, you can use my hairnet of knowledge.
Thank You Ponderer.
No! No! You Guys don't understand! It's not what you think!
You really thought you were going to get away from it, did you? First up, villains, what does BGATFBC?
It stands for the Bad Guys All Together For Book Club!
Book Club? You mean you weren't going to destroy a library or something?
Why would we do that? We're almost to the new chapter!
What are you going to do, lock us up for reading?
Yeah! You can't prison us for reading!
That's right. Remember kids, no one can imprison you for reading!
Hey, what happened? Why are those squiggles on the screen?
Those are called "End Credits," Patrick.
End credits? But I don't want it to end!
That's why Neptune gave us the rewind button!
Thank you Neptune!
Good morning, day!  Oww!  I stubbed my toe!  I stubbed my toe! I was walking around and I stubbed my toe!  D'oh, that was my favorite shirt.
And that was "Aja" by Eely Dan. Next up is Lionel Fishy with his hit, "Sad Song".
That's a sad song!
That SpongeBob is such a crybaby. Lucky me I get to work with him all day.
SpongeBob, guess what?  Yeah, I'll come back later.
He was a good little Krabby Patty.  I didn't know him well, but in the few short seconds between grill and floor, I----I came to love him!  It just isn't fair!
SpongeBob, will you stop crying?!
But the Krabby Patty fell on the floor and he—
Krabby Patty nothing!  KRABBY PATTY NOTHING!!!  What now?
You yelled at me! YOU YELLED AT ME!
All right, look. So far today, and it's not even 200 yet, you have cried 43 times.
And you wrote that number on a chalkboard.
Yes!
Why?
I have no idea.
Oh, Squidward, there's no way I cry that much. There's not that many tears in my brain.
Au contraire.
What's this?
It's a quick montage of flashbacks I've edited together that shows the hundreds of tears you have cried over the years.
Boo! Hoo! Boohoo! Sob. Whimper.
Thousands of tears later...
Wow, guess I do cry a lot. I promise I won't cry anymore.
Oh, nonsense! I bet you can't go the rest of the day without crying.
Excuse me a minute.
Star... residence. Patrick speaking.
Hey, Patrick.
Hey, buddy! Is it 730 already?
No, I'm still at work.
How can I help you?
Do you think that I could go the rest of the day without crying?
Well, of course you can.
Okay, great, thanks Patrick.
Umm... sure. And did you remember to put that package outside where I told you?
Yeah, but I left it in a different spot. Just ask Gary, he knows where it is.
Oh, yeah.  Hey, good one, buddy. You almost had me there.
Okay.
Yeah, talk to you later.
All right, see ya.  Okay, it's a bet.
Fine. If you cry one tear before midnight, you have to...  Wash my bike, clean out my rain gutters, and do all my yard work for a year.
Sounds fair to me. And if I make it to midnight without crying, you'll come to a slumber party at my place. Just you and me.  Ooh, what's the matter?
Um, nothing, I just threw up a little in my mouth.  No need to worry, Squiddy. You've outdone yourself. He'll be crying in ten minutes.
Thanks again for walking home with me, Squidward.
There's a first time for everything.  Also, I'd like to win this bet as soon as possible.
I am not gonna cry. I am not gonna cry.  I can do this.
Do what?  Oh, my! What a lovely sunset. Take a look, SpongeBob.  Isn't that beautiful?
I've never seen such a beautiful underwater sunset.
Really tugs the heartstrings, doesn't it?
It's...
Is that a tear I see?
Oh, well, sunset's over.  Nice of you to drop in, neighbor.
Nice of you to have me, I-- Oh, look SpongeBob. Gary's sleeping.
Aww. He looks like an angel.
That is just so adorable. Almost makes you want to cry.
Yeah.  No! There shall be no tears in this house tonight!  La-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la.
Oh, SpongeBob.
Yes?
Your mail's here. Ooh, oh look, it's a postcard from your dear mother and father so far away.
Mother, father?
"Dear SpongeBob, we are having a wonderful time in the South Seas and we miss you very, very much.
Ohh.  My subscription to Jellyfishing Monthly's expired. Remind me to renew that, will you, Squidward?
No problem.
Welcome back to Bikini Bottom News. Our top story tonight a series of sad tales.
Ooh, let's turn it up.
Tragedy in the park when a young snail caught in a tree almost didn't get down.
Meow.
However, he did get down.
Hooray!
Coming up, an interview with a manatee who didn't get what he wanted for his birthday.
Oh, no.
And finally, sad news for Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy fans.
What, what, what?
They will only be showing The Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy Show seven times a day instead of eight—
Let's watch something else Squidward, okay?
Fine!
Hey, Dad, how about a game of catch?
Sorry, son, I'm late for work.
Okay, Dad.
I guess I can stay for a few throws.
I love you, Dad.
I love you, son.
You know what they say about that television. Rots the brain.
Hey, thanks for the TV, SpongeBob.  I'm gonna watch it all night!
It's getting late. I'd better bring out the big guns.  Oh, SpongeBob.
Yes, Squidward?
What would you say to a little music?
I'd say... I'll go get some refreshments.
Don't be long. My secret weapon is waiting. ", then chuckles]
You said something, Squidward?
Oh, I just said, "Relax and enjoy the song."
That's a really sad song, Squidward.
You're not gonna cry though, are you?
No.  Time really does fly when you're having fun. Well, I'd better start getting ready for bed.
Uh, SpongeBob. No-no-no-no, wait.
Yes, Squidward?
How about a bedtime story?
Now you're talking!  Whatcha gonna read me, Squidward?
Umm...  How 'bout The Little Angler Who Got Lost?
That sounds like a very sad story.
Oh, very sad. Umm... "There once was a little angler  who was, uh, little and sad.  One day the little sad angler was walking through the park.
Walking...

But, he was sad, because...because he was lost... he was lost and very sad. And then, he— he started to cry.  He cried and he cried. And he cried even more.  And he kept crying...  ...and crying and crying and crying and...that's right. You can do it.
I'm wondering if it might not be so healthy to hold in all my tears, Squidward.

You're exactly right, SpongeBob. Let it all out. Don't fight the feel-- Ten, nine...do it, do it, cry...eight, seven, six, five...come on!  ...four, three, two, one!  Midnight!  Well, SpongeBob, it looks like you won the...
Wow, what a great show.
Well, at least we're still together, little ones.
More popcorn, Squidward?
No, no. No, no. Please.
Don't be shy now. I made extra.  That's all right, let it out. You can cry all you want. You're among friends here.
Have a good summer vacation, I'll see you all next fall!  Well... Hopefully not all of you.
Weee!
Time to vamoose!
Oh, Mrs. Puff?
Where are my keys!?
Mrs. Puff!?
Come on!
I've got something for you!  Mrs. Puff?
I gotta get out of here!  Phew! I lost him.
Mrs. Puff?  Can I give you my note now?
Why can't you take a hint?!
Help!
Oh dear, of course I'll help.
Mrs. Puff!  Don't forget to read the note!
Why won't he just-  Oh no! Not again! If my parole officer finds out, I don't stand a chance! I'll be sentenced for life this time!
Hmmm... Quite a conundrum you have here. It would be a cryin' shame to a certain someone if this information were to leak out to the authorities.
Oh please, don't tell the police, I'll be dead man if I get caught! I'll do anything!
It's gonna cost a fortune to get this fixed. Thanks to you.
Oh, gracious me, I don't have that kind of cash!
Don't worry! I think we can work something out.
Huh? You mean we should go out on a date?
Err... interesting, No, I had something else in mind. Surprise, SpongeBob! You got a new co-worker.
Mrs. Puff!
She'll be filling in for Squidward while he's...  ...on vacation! Isn't that right, Mrs. Puff?
That's right.
She'll be workin unpaid until he returns. Won't she?
Yeah.
Squidward! I forgot to tell ya. You're taking a summer off! Have a good time! See ya!  Phew! That was close.
It all sounds a bit mysterious to me. Oh but why should I care? I'm working with good old Mrs. Puff! Say, did you get my note?
Oh, I got your note alright.
So what do you think?
What did I think!? I think it caused me to- Let's just say, it changed my life.
It certainly has. Now SpongeBob, would you please show Mrs. Puff her new duties vis-a-vis with her recently changed life? 'Cause I'm sure a snail can't be bothered to do it.
Oh boy! I get to show you the ropes Mrs. Puff! Hey, it's kind of like I'm the teacher!  I'm gonna be teaching you now.
Patience is a virtue.
Shall we start with the importance of good kitchen hygiene or the unabridged history of the patty?
Why don't we just start with my basic duties?
Eager to get behind the wheel, eh? I like it. Repeat after me, this is my register, there are many like it but this one is mine!
There are many like it but this one is mine.
Now like a ships rudder this old register is temperamental. When you hit the total key... What are you doing?  You're not taking notes!? Always remember Good Grades.
Always follow diligent notes!
I know, SpongeBob. I taught you that phrase!
Don't worry, Mrs. Puff, you can borrow my notepad today!  Now, where was I... Oh yes! The total key is a bit sticky so you're gonna have to be forceful but not too forceful. Get it?
Forceful but not too forceful.

You did! Diligence like this deserves a sticker!  Collect 10 and your entitled to a super sticker!  Why don't we work on our customer service with a little role playing, I'll be the customer and you show me your best and friendliest service, hmm?
Fine...
Good day ma lady, charmed, I'm sure.
Heh, funny costume SpongeBob.
Forgive me, I know not of this SpongeBob fellow. My name is Yukthomas Féyêdêmuffin and I entered your place of business in hope to pro-clearing lunch on this fine day.
Of course Mr. Féyêdêmuffin. What would you like to eat today?
Psst, Mrs. Puff, it's me, SpongeBob, I think it will go smoother if you refer to him as "duke."
You mean to refer to you as Duke?
Of course, how else one refer to me? I am a duke after all, now I shall fancy a meal if quite alright with you.
Okay, duke, what will you have?
I shall have... Beans on toast please.
All right, one beans on toast coming up!
Psst, Mrs. Puff, SpongeBob again, you better inform the Duke that we don't serve beans on toast.
This is just ridiculous! Would you simply explain my duties please?!
What are you doing yelling at me customers? The duke here is one of me regulars, and I don't need to explain what happens when you start losing your regularity, do I?
Oh dear... Message received, Mr. Krabs.
Just don't let it happen again, Puff.
Well, I see you have a little trouble getting in gear there, but you'll be in the fast lane before you know it!  Ah! Here comes another customer! Let's see if you can apply what you learned!
Welcome to the Krusty Krab, sir. May I take your order?
Yes!
One Krabby Patty please?
$1 please. Thank you.
Good job, Mrs. Puff! Now all that's left is to submit the order to the cook.
One Krabby Patty!
Oh, Mrs. Puff!
What?
It must have slipped your mind that you need to submit the order in writing as well. It's the only way to ensure maximum clarity.
Fine! Here's your written form!
One Krabby Patty. Uh, Mrs. Puff?
What now?

I can't begin cooking until the bell is rung.  Thank you! Although a smidge less rigorous next time please?  Order up! You done well so far student! Now all that's left is to deliver the item to the customer. Be cautious, but swift. Oh, I wouldn't go that way if I were you. It's faster if you go this way, Mrs. P, look out for the barrel!
I'll give your barr-

Watch for pedestrians!  Pot hole!  Look out, Mrs. Puff!  Time for evasive action!  And the patty is unscathed! Way to go Mrs. Puff! Your first satisfied customer! Although I have to deduct points for that landing though.
That's it! I don't care anymore! This isn't worth it!  I will not be humiliated any longer!
Don't forget to read the note!
You! it's because of you I got stuck in this mess!
Hold it right there! Well, well, well, if it ain't Mrs. Puff. I saw what you did.
I. You did?
Yeah.

column1: Mrs. Puff  Oh please! I didn't mean to do it! I swear!

column2: It's too late for swearing Mrs. Puff! The evidence is right here.  You littered, now you're going to the stony lonesome.
Littered? You're absolutely right officer! Yes! I sure did litter! That's what I did!
Yeah, all right. You're under arrest now.
No problem officer, time by myself in the stoney lonesome is just what I need!
Tell it to the judge Mrs. Puff!
1 day down, 2,528 to go! That's just shy of 4 years without SpongeBob! I'm going to enjoy this!
Get up Puff! The judge says you have to go to traffic school.
Oh Wow! A Driver's Education class! This is just how I made a living except without HIM. Delightful!
Good day class!
I must be having a nightmare! what's he doing here?!

Didn't you read the note, Mrs. Puff? Here, I taped it together and saved it just in case.  Dear Mrs. Puff, I'm following in your footsteps and got a job as a Driver's Ed teacher for the summer. ♥ SpongeBob.  Now let's open our Driver's Ed handbooks to Chapter 1.
Ahh, that's the stuff.  Hey, something don't smell right. SpongeBob! Hey, what are you burning out here, boy?
Hmm... I'd say a hydrated explosive.
Explosive!?
Ha ha ha ha! Enjoy, Eugene!
Plankton! I just had that roof redone last week!
You will be re-re-doing it when I'm through with you!
Ready for instant?  Fire!  Take cover!  Oh, ha, ha, it didn't blow up another dud, Plankton.
Another dud huh?
Oh, you're playing with fire now, Plankton!
No need to get worked up with this Krabs, just give me the secret formula and off I go.
Well you ain't getting it.
Well I constrict you to reconsider.
Oh, go jump off a plank.
Oh well, I have other ways of getting it when I need where is the formula Krabs?
Ha ha ha ha!
Still not going to talk 'ay' Krabs?  OK Krabs, I see you're still not going to crack but I don't think your underling is of the same metal.
I'll never talk.
Well, we'll see what Mr. Feather has to say about that.
OK, OK! but I don't how to get into the safe behind the painting in Mr. Krabs' office that houses the secret formula! He won't let me near it!
Clever, behind the painting ay Krabs?
Errrrrrrr...
Say what am I smelling? you got something burning?
Smells like blubber to me.
Bl bl blubber?
Daddy!
Ahhhhh! Call off your daughter Krabs! Call her off!
She's a big girl Plankton, I have no control over what she does. Oh, And you better watch out. I think she's extra hungry today.
Stay back whale! I'm pippy to what you do to organisms like me. I've seen those documentaries!
Did he just go into the freezer?
Don't say it!
I prefer salad over Plankton anyway.
Who knew Plankton was so afraid of whales?  Pearl me darling daughter, you saved my business and my Formular now get us out of this trap.
Mall money.
Alright, alright. You're gettin' more like your old man every day. . Pearl, why don't you swing to the Chum Bucket on your way to the mall? Give Plankton a little scare?
Double my mall money!
Alright, SpongeBob. It's your turn!
Here you go, Pearl. Buy something pretty.
Hey, this isn't money!
No, it's even better! It's the money Mr. Krabs pays me with.  Mr. Krabs' Wacky Bucks!
It's all catching up to me...  Please, Pearl?
No way! The Chum Bucket is, like, totally gross!
Hmmm... in that case, I'll need to borrow one of your dressers.
Hummina-hunh?/Huh?!
My triumphant husband returns. How'd you fail this time?
Krabs had a whale!
You mean his big, scary, teenage daughter?
I hear that mocking tone in your voice Karen, and I don't appreciate it! Don't you remember what happened to my ancestors at the hands of those beasts?
OK When you take a break from your delusional paranoia, the trash needs some attention. It's ripened.
I'm hungry!
That should keep her out!
I want Plankton meat!
Holy, protozoa!  Karen! she's here! She got in!
What are you talking about?
There's a whale in the laboratory!
Are you out of your mind?
See for yourself!
No whale in here.
I swear! A whale was just in here. She was next to the transmutator. She was right here in this spot! Her mouth all frothy, her blowhole blowing!
Oh that's enough Plankton! If you'll excuse me, I have to get back to more permanent primary functions.
Karen! Karen--!
I'm not listening! Hm hm hm!
16 paranoia filled days later...
Plankton, your dinner is ready. Plankton? Plankton, do you hear me?
Yes, Karen. I can hear you. Could you please bring it up? I can't risk stepping into the light. The whale might see me.
Hey! Get me out of here!
Hey Plankton! Glad you could join the rest of the family!
Grand-Dad?
Yep, and you're pretty brave standing in that there gastric acid.
Gastric acid?  No!  I can't take it! Oh, this is driving me crazy!
What's the point of going on? I'll just be tortured for the rest of my life by that whale!  That's it. I'm done. The 415 bus should be here any time now.
Hi, Plankton. Whatchya doin' laying on the middle of the road?
Go away, CheeseHead! Can't you see I'm trying to get run over? In fact, better yet just step on me as hard as you can, will ya?
I'm sorry, Plankton, but that flies in the face of my good nature.
Forget it kid. I'll just wait for the next bus. Go on back to the Krusty Krab and enjoy yourself.
Okay!
Goodbye, Pipsqueak!
Sorry to interrupt your gloating sir, I just thought it would be pertinent for you to know that Plankton is laying on the street, forlorn.
Really? He's a mess!
Mr. Krabs, I know you and Plankton are both sworn enemies and all, but putting on a dress to frighten him? Isn't that taking it a little too far?
May I remind you of the fact that you've disclosed the location of me safe, where I keep the secret formula?
No need to remind me, sir. I've broken Rule #2 of the Krusty Krab Rule Book Never disclose the location of the secret formula! Don't worry, Mr. Krabs. I'll fix this.
Man, what does it take to get run over around here?!
Hi, Plankton.
What, do you have mud in your ears? Take a hike!
Yes, I remember. But, I just wanted to tell that the secret formula is not, I repeat not, in the safe behind the painting in the Krusty Krab.
What difference does it make? There's no point ever since I've been tortured by that blasted whale.
Don't worry. Everyone has a secret fear! For instance, Mr. Krabs' secret fear is...
Really?
Mmm-hmm, and guess what else? It was Mr. Krabs in whale suit that you've been scared of.
You mean this entire time it's been Krabs masquerading as a whale!?  Why that conniving bottom feeder!
But, certainly you wouldn't have use for such, innocuous information, would you?
No, of course not.
Well, back to your self-destructive behavior, Plankton. Thank you for this talk!
No, no. Thank you!
This is almost too fun!  Plankton ain't even a challenge no more!
Oh, is that so.
Oh, Plankton. Back for more, aren'y ya? Okay, here it goes.  Boo!
You don't scare me, Krabs.
I ain't Krabs, I'm... uh, I mean...  I'm Pearl, not Krabs.
The jig is up, Krabs. I know all about the suit, AND your secret fear!
Secret fear?  What are you talkin' about?
See for yourself.  Enjoy the show!
No. No. Muh-muh-make it stop! Please!
Doesn't feel so good on the other end of the stick, doesn't it scaredy pants? I feel wonderful!
Um, Plankton, if I were you I wouldn't be so smug.
Why not?
Because a hungry pod of whales just showed up for its early feeding.
Ahhhh! Not another feeding! Get me out of here!
Whew! You really redeemed yourself boy!  Okay, you're beginning to creep me out.
Help! Help!
Monica!
Brad!
Oh, Monica, I've thought I might never find you.  I promise to never leave you at your side.
Oh, Brad.
Oh, Monica.
Do you know what today is little guy?
Meow?
It's take Gary a walk in a park day!
Meow.

column1: [Gary is about to slither away when SpongeBob leashes him and takes him for a walk. Scene cuts to the Snail Park where all the other snails live. SpongeBob and Gary walk in

column2: Isn't this great Gary? A whole park full of your own species.  Go ahead, have a good time.  I'll just sit down here for a sec. [falls asleep with the two owners. Gary sees the two other snails on the swing feeling bored then he sees one snail about to climb up the ladder where the slide is next to and falls down bored, and Gary sees the seasaw where a little snail named 'Mary' is on. Gary's eyes turn into hearts and slithers to the other side of the seasaw. Mary sees Gary who is falling in love with her.
Meoooow.
Meooow.
MREOOOW REOOOOW REOOOW REOOOW! OOF!
Hey, light wit! What do you think you're doing with my girl?  Come on Mary, let's go.
Mreoooow.
You've just made a big mistake pal.
Grrrrr...
Say good-bye to your friends, Gary! Play time's over! I'll just wip you up some dinner!
Meoooow.
Meoooow.
Let's go, Mary.
Hey, this ain't over, runt! When I'm get through with you, the doctor won't know where to sow your lips back on... or two!  That little runt is going to get what's coming to him!
Mmm-mmm seaweed noodle stew.
Meow.
Bon appetit, Gary, I made it with extra love.  Well it's not exacily what I had in mind but knock yourself out.
One, two. One, two.  Oh. There you are. That sure is a knock out dinner, ey?
Meow.
Come on Gary, it's time for beddy bye!  Night night, Gare-Bare.

Good morning, Gary!  Hmm? He's not here. Oh. Right. He's probably playing with the litter box again.  Peek-a-boo!  Hmm? Not in here either.  Gary? Where are you?  Hmph. I am gonna teach that snail how to clean up after himself.  Huh? What's this? Is this some kind of ransom note?  Holy Neptune! My pet Gary has been snailnapped by a deranged snail-lover!  Don't worry Gare-Bare, I'll save you!
Meow?
Meeooooooooow...
Meow reow.
After me, fellas.
Hey, how come we never go to the front, guys?
'Cause bad guys don't never use the front door!
Well, I think that's pretty ridiculous.
All right. Listen up! Any of you seen a snail come through here? About a... ye tall, a shell, couple of eyes?
I think you have to be more descriptive.

Oh, okay, let's see here. Uhh, this preticular snail think it's real funny to make googley eyes on my girl.  Hey! What you was all giggling at? Theys giggling at me! Alright, that's it! You weres all going on my list! He's got that... you're all on the list!
Gary? Gary? Where are you, buddy?  Snail slime! Looks like it could be Gary's.  Now for the true test.  Uh-hun. It is Gary's slime. I'm on the trail, Gary!
Why, hello there little fellow. Are you a stray?  There you are. Isn't that better?
Meow reow.
Meow meow meow meow?
No. No I haven't seen any stray snails nearby.
He's trying to pull up the fast one, fellas.  Why don't we give him a taste of our own grand of swift justice?!
Two hours later...
Ha! That's enough, boys. I've think we've done a ferrow job.
Yeah. Let's go back to finding that snail.
Hey Boss, there's one left.
Oh yeah?  I know you weres in there, you little runt!
YAAAAH!
HAAAAH!
AHH MOMMY! MOMMY!
You!  Come back here! You gotta help me clean this place up!  You brought this on yourself, Harold. No I didn't Harold. Yes you did Harold. Harold I did not.
Come on, move it!  Get out of the road!
Where do you think you're going?
Get' em!
Meoooow.
Meooow.
Gary? Gary?!
What the?  What do you think you're doing in my car? No free rides, loafer!
Hold it right there! Hands off my Gary you snailnapper!
Snailnapper?  I don't want your dumb ol' snail.
Oh yeah. I suppose he wandered out of the house in the middle of the night just as though he can jump into your car.
Meow.
Not now Gary, I'm scolding. And I suppose... Wh-wha-what?
Meow meow meow meow. Meow.
You did wander out of the house on your own? But why?  Oh, I see why. Good ol' fashion to Mary!
Hey! This ain't over yet, runt!
Monica? Monica!
Brad!
Oh, Monica, I've thought I've never find you Monica. I was just taking Billy here for a walk.
Meoooow.
Meow.
Huh?
Meow?
I promise to never again leave you at your side. Now let us go get some steamed hot cup of joe.
Oh, Brad.
Oh, Monica.
That's gotta hurt, Gary.
Meow reow.
Eh. Come on runt, I'll show you this great dumpster where we can find some seaweed noodle stew.
Meow!
Don't stay out too late, Gary!  They grow up so fast.
Delivery for Mr. Squidward Tentacles.
Hello? Anybody here?
Squidward's not at his post!
Hmm! There's something missing. Ah!
Hello! Yoo-hoo? Mail delivery!
Hello, I'm Squidward. Welcome to the Krusty Krab where we never leave our post.
And how may I help you on this fine day?
Rrriiiight...
Hey! It's hard to get my beauty sleep when people keep dropping junk on my head.
Hooray! Yahoo!
WHOOPEE! Ha ha ha! Whoopee! Woo-
PEE!
Whoo-
Pee.
Whoop...
PEE!
Avast, there. What are you all happy about?
I'm on my happy break, Mr. Krabs.
You, I'm used to. Why is he so happy?
I'm holding a package from famous producer Buddy Barracuda. I sent him my play and now, he's gonna produce it!
I quit.
So long, losers!
Let's see here. Ahem. Oh, yeah.
"Thank you for submitting your play, entitled 'Squidward Strokes of Genius'. Your work speaks volumes about you as an artist, a person, and a member of society."
So it is with great pleasure that we announce we will not be doing your play.
Hey! Squidward! You're back from your amazing success as a playwriter!
And your shirt, is that a cotton-poly blend? Faaancy!
And just look at your stylish new hairdo.
Say, is that a copy of your play? Oh, my goodness! Are you going to put on your amazing play in our little old Krusty Krab? Oh, you are a true patron of the arts, Squidward!
Well, I suppose that could work. If people see my play, they'll recognize my genius! And I'll become famous and-
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa! Me customers come here for greasy food at high prices. Not for singin' and dancin'.
But my play doesn't have singing-
But, Mr. Krabs, people pay to eat, right?
Of course.
And they would pay to watch a play, right?
Um, I suppose...
Well, if they eat and watch a play, you can charge twice as much!
Really? How about four times as much?
Well, I don't see why not!
Well...OK. But only on one condition that you both keep workin'. Because if just one Krabby Patty is late, I'm shuttin' you down!
Hmmm. Now what will we call this eating dinner and watching theater?
Dinner theater?
Oh, you. Oh, sure.
No. Come on, let's get serious. We need a title that sounds...dramatic! Got it! We'll call it "Singy Eaty Time!"
But SpongeBob, there's no singing in my-
I love it!
Wow! Look at all these aspiring actors wanting to take part in my genius!
And all of them willin' to work for no pay!
Did I get the part?
You got all the parts.
And we let him handle our food?
Huh...Singy Eaty Time with Squidward Tentacles.
Hello, can I order? Hello?
It's time!
Places, people, places!
Please take your seats.
Dim the house lights.
Bring up the stage lights!
Raise the curtain!
How much am I gettin' for this?
Onto this world, an octopus was born. A cephalopod with promise and potential.
Um, I'd like a Double Krabby meal with extra kelp...
Go away, go away, shoo, shoo, go away, go away.
What did I tell you? You do your job, or I'm shuttin' you down!
Fine.
He had promise until he came to work here, at the Krusty Krab. Serving local morons heart-stopping, artery-clogging garbage, masquerading as food.
Yay-hey!
At the Krusty Krab, his talent was wasted.
Excuse me, can I get a refill?
No, you ca-
Squidward...
Sigh...Yes, you can.
But, who will refill the empty chasm in my soul?
I...don't know, man...I don't know.
His life shattered. Is there any task too demeaning for our hero?
Hey, my Krabby Patty doesn't have ketchup.
It would appear not. No ketchup! That's terrible! Here, let me help you with that.
Would any of you want this job?
Squidward! You get that customer a fresh patty with ketchup! Now! And don't forget to charge him again!
And then, there's my skinflint boss.
What's that, Mr. Squidward?
Umm, Mr. Krabs, I'm acting.
Oh, well, that's OK, then. But get him a Krabby Patty!
Fine. SpongeBob! One Krabby Patty with ketchup! And now, we come to the worst part of my job...working with him.
Huh? Um, ahem, ah...I...uh...I forgot my lines!
You don't have any lines!
I don't?
D'oh! Just stand there and act like...yourself!
Oh, I can do that! Ahem! One Krabby Patty coming up!
Oh, what is this. A stray wrapper in my kitchen.
Oh, the trash is full. I had better call...the garbage truck.
Talent.
Outstanding. Thank you, that'll do. Ahem. But, lo and behold-
Hey, man! Where's my Krabby Patty?
His genius was unrecognized.
Come on, man! I just want my patty!
Yeah, me too!
Taken for granted, uncredited, overlooked, ignored. Disrespected, unappreciated, unloved. But worst of all...underpaid.
It's funny, 'cause it's true!
He's done. Order.
Uh-
And furthermore!
Oh, there's furthermore.
Unfulfilled. In a word, his myriad of talents were,  wasted.
Oh, come ON!
We want Krabby Patties! We want Krabby Patties! We want Krabby Patties! We want Krabby Patties!
Squidward! You still haven't given me customers their Krabby Patties!
All right! SpongeBob, where's that Patty?!
What have I done? Have I let the lure of theatre production get between me and my patties?
Squidward, forgive me. I let the glamour of the stage distract me from my true calling Making sure that every patty I prepare is the best it can be.
Uh huh.
No, Squidward, no. Those patties aren't fit for public consumption.
Here! Enjoy!
Ugh!
Oh, come on! All that waiting for this?!
Oh, puh-leeze. You wouldn't know quality if it hit you in the face!
D'oh! I said if it hit YOU in the face!
Whoa! That was worth the wait! I'll take two more!
I'll take five!
I wanna throw something at him!
Wait! Gentle patrons, Krabby Patties are meant to be eaten, not flung. Think of all the joy these greasy, juicy patties and their attendant condiments have given you.
Gosh, he's right.
We shouldn't be so disrespectful of our favorite meal.
Bless you all.
I like throwing food.
Food fight!
And for you?
I'll take twenty.
Do you have anything heavier?
Certainly.
Oh boy.
Squidward! Squidward!
Good news. The play is such a success, I've added two more shows and a matinee! Break a leg tomorrow!

Ah, the eternal expanse of the deep sea. Teeming with fantastic creatures. Uh, teeming… I’m sure they’re around here somewhere! Aha!  Oh, that’s a rock! Where is everybody?   Oh, it is just SpongeBob. Watch and witness one of the rarest and mysterious rituals of the deep, the staring contest.
Patrick, wow!
What?
You are the best starer I’ve ever stared at!
Oh, staring contest! I thought it was a blinking contest and I was losing.
Hark, Patrick. Do you hear something?  Oh!  Hmm, it’s a letter for Sandy, all the way from Texas. We better deliver it!
Sandy!  Oh, it’s not opening!
Hey, SpongeBob! I have something that might help.
How to open things. Brilliant, Patrick! I saw the movie, but I never read the book.
Uh, ok.  Garbage cans. No. Jar. No. Box. No. Sandy’s door! Twist to the left.
Oh! I was twisting to the right.
A common mistake, my good friend.  Allow me.  Ok, time to open this.
Hi-yah! Trying to ninja sneak attack? Hi-yah! Hi-yah!  Well, you’re still no match for my squirrel-fu!  It’s a letter from my twin brother, Randy!
Oh!
Do you mind?
Not at all. Read on.
Doesn’t bother me.
Get out of my suit!  Well, golly! Randy says the rodeo’s come to town. I’ve got to head back to Texas and defend my championship title!
Championship title? For what?
You got cotton in your ears?
Hmm, no. It’s not cotton. It’s actually an old moldy piece of Krabby Patty.  Mmm.
Is your championship title for jellyfishing?
No.
Karate?
No!
Perhaps the science fair, then.
No. It’s my rodeo championship on the line.
Rodeo? What does rodeo mean?

♪Critters that you gotta wrangle.♪  ♪Cowboy suits with perty spangles.♪  ♪Boots with spurs that jingle jangle, that's a rodeo. Tight blue jeans you gotta squeeze in, but they sure look mighty pleasin'!♪  ♪Big belt buckles are always in season!♪  ♪That's a rodeo.♪
♪Rodeo♪
♪Rodeo♪
♪Rodeo♪
♪Rodeo♪
♪Yippee ti yay, yippy ti yo♪
♪Rodeo♪
♪Rodeo♪
♪Rodeo♪
♪Yippee ti yay, yippy ti yo♪

♪Ride that critter, don’t be no quitter! Hold on tight with all your might! Yee-haw! That’s a rodeo. Tractor pulls and big old bulls.♪  ♪Line dancin’, horses prancin’!♪  ♪Barrel racin’, bareback ridin’!♪  ♪Bronco bustin’,  aluminium sidin’.♪  ♪That’s a rodeo.♪
♪Rodeo♪
♪Rodeo!♪
♪Rodeo♪
♪Rodeo!♪
♪Yippee ti yay, yippy ti yo♪
♪Rodeo♪
♪Rodeo!♪
♪Rodeo♪
♪Rodeo!♪
♪Yippee ti yay, yippy ti yo♪
♪And don’t forget who makes us laugh when we’re feelin’ down. The happy slappy, sunny, funny good ol’ rodeo clown.♪
Clowns?  Don’t go, Sandy! It’s too risky!
I must! It’s my duty!
Oh, this is terrible! We can’t let Sandy go all alone! It’s too dangerous up there, right Patrick?
Eh, I’m indifferent.
How could we live with ourselves if Sandy got hurt, and we weren’t there to help? Why, I wouldn’t be able to look at myself.
Look at yourself? How do you do that?
Patrick! This is no time for silly games! Sandy needs us. You understand? Patrick? Patrick!
No more tight jeans!
Oh, I’m sure someone else will help me.
So there you have it, Mr. Krabs. Sandy really needs our help.
Ok, explain it to me again, but this time, take out anything that doesn’t have to do with money. Uh-huh, that’s what I thought.
I need to find someone with compassion. Someone who selflessly helps others, with no concern for his own safety. I need…A hero.
Oh, Squidward! Sandy is in terrible trouble. You’ve got to help me save her!
Oh, no! Sally’s in trouble!
Uh, Sandy.
Don’t worry, SpongeBob. Just wait right here.  I’ll get my emergency squirrel rescue kit!
Right-o, Mr. Tentacles, sir!
Just don’t panic!
Ooh uh. Well, there’s one last person I can ask.
Plankton!
What?
Sandy’s in trouble. I need help rescuing her.
I’m kind of busy right now.
Jeepers, it’ll only take a minute.
Yea, uh I’d love to help, but I really got to go.  Ouch.
Ugh. Well, I’m going to go save Sandy, whether anyone wants to help or not.
I guess it’s just you and me, Gary.  Let’s go. Gary the snail! Do you plan on staying here while Sandy is possibly in trouble somewhere up there?
Meow meow meow?
She’s the squirrel.
Meow?
No, brown. Gary, what does that have to do  You too, huh? Well, we’ll see about that!
Eh, pudding.
Good morning!
SpongeBob! What’s the meaning of this?
Sandy’s in trouble, and I need all of your help to save her from the horrors of the rodeo! There are clowns there!
SpongeBob, the next time you ‘invite’ me to one of your slumber parties, I’m calling the cops!   Arrgh, Arrgh, oh, oh. What the? SpongeBob!
Oh. Yes, Squidward?

column1: Everyone who was trapped in a bubble, except Squidward

column2: Where the devil are we?
It's... Texas.
Meow.
What’s that, boy? You see Sandy?
Meow.
And she’s…riding a bullfrog?
Yee-haw!
Ahoy, Sandy!
Huh?
Ribbit!
Ow. Gall darn it! You sea slickers made me lose the rodeo. Why are you here, anyways?
To help save you from this rodeo thing!  You need to get out of here!
I don’t need to be saved!  Watch out! That old bullfrog’s got a flea on his flanks, and he’s comin’ right at ya!
Ribbit, ribbit!
Ribbit.
Did we save Sandy?
No, Patrick. We didn’t.
Did we make any money?
Meow.
Aw, cactus! That ol’ bullfrog’s got SpongeBob! Hang on, old buddy!  Next time, leave the rodeos to me.
Aw, nuts.
How about a little more, Plankton, or has this old granny had enough for one night?
Oh, Grandma, you know I always have more pudding for you!
Oh, that looks simply delightful!
You once told me that this was your favorite flavor growing up as a child.
Ration?
Uh, no, chocolate. Open up!  You can let go of the spoon now, Grandma. There. Oops, looks like you've got a little on your face. Here, let me.  There you are. There you are, darling.
Oh, Plankton. You always were my favorite granddaughter!
Five minutes until bedtime, Mr. Plankton.
Well, Grandma, that's the sweetest, most tender...
Five minutes, Mr. Plank...
I HEARD YOU THE FIRST TIME! Now, where were we?  Grandma, don't forget your teeth.

Ooh. Uh, uh, now, now, Grandma, just relax. There, there.  That's perfect!  PERFECT!  Why didn't I think of this before? No one can say "No" to a helpless little grandma!  Excuse me, Sonny, I'd simply love one of your Krabby what's-it's, but my delicate digestive system has special needs, and I'll need to see a complete list of ingredients. You wouldn't want me to be up all night with painful bloating, would you?
Goodness, no!  Here you are.
Thanks, Sonny! I'm just going to take it home; I left my bifocals there.  '

La-la, la-la, la-la! La-la, la-la, la-la!  Yay!! A DIRECT HIT!  Threat neutralized, Captain. ... Roger. Over. ... Uh-huh. Right away, Captain. All hands, prepare to dive! Repeat prepare to di--  Hi, lady!
Why, SpongeBob. Don't you recognize me?
Ehh, not really...
It's me, your dear old great-grammyma!
Quick, come inside!  Wow, my very own great-grammyma. Why have we never met?
I want to know all about your life—your job, where the secret formula is...  I mean...

I'm so glad you came back...  ...Double-Great Grammyma.  You're cold. Let's wrap you up in something nice and cozy.  Okay, lean forward.  There we go, now lean back, Grammyma. It's the coziest pillow I have.  How about we look through some old family photo albums?  Here's a picture of me when I developed my first appendage.  Pretty neat photo album, eh, Double-G Grammyma?
It was certainly interesting, but I'd like to hear about your more recent affairs, like where you work, for instance.
Ha, ha, ha, ha, don't worry. I've got pictures of that too...  ...but we have a couple more from my early childhood to get through first.
Never let it be said that I didn't suffer for my occupation.
Great-Graaaaaaamyma...?
Huh?!? Oh, I had the most horrible dream of my life! I was dressed up as...!  Holy mother of Neptune, it's true.
Good mooorning. I'll go and fix us a nice breakfast, and then we'll spend the whole day together!
Uh, sounds delightful.  Heh, heh, heh, heh, heh.
So, Grammyma, what kinds of things do you active seniors like to do?
Actually, SpongeBob, I said I wanted to see your life, remember?
Hmmmm...
I want to know all about your life—your job, where the secret formula is...  I mean...
No, you couldn't possibly care about any of that stuff. Your life must be way more full and exciting.
Well, uh...
Come on, it'll be fun!  Ahhh. Isn't this tea delicious, Grandma?
Why, yes!  HOW CAN YOU DRINK THIS DRECK?!  Heh, heh, heh, heh... What I meant to say was, "More, please."
Knitting circles sure are fun, eh, Grammyma?
Nope.
Why are you not having fun?
Why?! BECAUSE I DON'T KNIT, YOU NITWIT!
Are you sure? 'Cause you make a real nice scarf.  Oh, Great-Grammyma, you win again. All hail the great Canasta "masta"!  Grandma, you getting bored?
No, I'm getting hungry. I can feel my own stomach acids eating away at my organs. I COULD EAT A VILLAGE!
Would you settle for a Krabby Patty?
Would I?  Uh, yeah, I would.  Uh, SpongeBob, would you mind terribly if we used the rear entrance? I'm a little shy around new people.
Hmm... Hey, Grammy, do antenna run in our family?
Antenna... What?! No, I...!
Oh-ho-ho-ho! Ah, she really is shy. Nobody ever uses this door except for me and...  ...Squidward!
AAAH!
SpongeBob, you have been warned about lurking back here on your days off!
I'm just bringing in my great-grammyma for some lunch.
Your what?
My great-grammyma!  She must be hiding. Well, she did say she was shy.
Right...  SpongeBob, I promise not to tell Mr. Krabs about this if you promise that I don't have to see you again for the rest of the day.
Grammy, there you are. I was starting to worry.
Never mind. Just get me into the kitchen!
Well, here it is.
AT LAST!
Grandma, I'm just gonna go make sure the restrooms are stocked. You, know, real quick—it's part of my day-off duties.
Okay. I'll be standing right here when you get back, and not off somewhere snooping around for the secret formula or anything.
Ha, ha, ha... What?
Nothing, go ahead!  Let's see how this decoy floats your boat. Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha!

Okay, Grammyma, that's taken care of. I...  Grammyma! She must've made her own way up to the cash register all by herself! Maybe I'll catch up on my dishwashing while I have the chance.  The Krusty Krab manual says it is always a good idea to start by turning the garbage disposal on, just in case there is any leftover rubbish in the sink.  Sounds like there's something stuck in the si- Grandma!  Oh, I can't bear to look!  Oh, Double-Great-Grammy-Grams, you were so soft and fragile like a... like a... like a... like a balloon!!
SpongeBob, SpongeBob, up here!
Grandma, is that you? Are you all right?
Oh! I'm all right, but I've been ground to a pulp. If only there was a nice, cool, safe place nearby, like a safe nearby, where I could rest and recover.

Well, there is the safe where Mr. Krabs keeps the Krusty Krab secret formula that Plankton's been trying to steal for the past bunch of years, but I don't think he'd mind if my dear old grammyma rests in there.
Why would he?
Here you go. I'll come back for you a little later.
Oh, I feel better already.
Sweet dreams, Grammyma.

Sweet dreams, indeed, fool. Only this dream is about to become a nightmare, for Mr. Krabs! Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha...!  I'm just going to savour this moment, because for once in my life—for once in my life—I feel TRULY ALIVE!
PLANKTON!  You've been a very naughty BOY, Plankton!
B-But-But-But I...  Grandma, I can...
I've been looking all over for this stuff!
Grandma, I can explain!
I'm sure you can. Plankton Jr., you know you always were a...
Grandma?  You caught Plankton! Let me guess—trying to steal the secret formula, right?
Get out of my way, rapscallion!  I've had enough foolishness for one day.
I'm sorry, Gary. I thought you were done....  Wow. This town is sure going downhill.  Uhh, Mr. Krabs. What are you doing out here?
Well...you know...unwinding. Enjoying the free parking.   What's happening to your little critter here?
I don't know, but when he does that he usually finds change.
Change? As in legal tender?
Yeah. Watch.
Wow. Shiver me shell wax. You're like a little money detecting... Uh... You know... A sneagle.
You mean snail.
Thank you, SpongeBob. How about you bring your sneagle into work with ye?
You said pets were not nothing but disease-carrying vermins that should never be brought to the workplace.
But that was before I knew that they had such an amazing talent.
But the whole process causes Gary big discomfort. I could never do it to him.
I could.
There you go. Bring in that change. I've been working on that one for months. Arr, arr, arr, arr, arr, arr, arr!
What's so funny, Mr. Krabs?
Uhh...SpongeBob. Shouldn't you be out back scrubbing the dumpster?
Done and done!
Then get back there and scrub the poop deck so to speak.
Yes sir!
Hey! What are you doing with my change?!
Anything on the floor gains.
Hey!
Arr, arr, arr, arr, arr. Looks like I need pockets for me pockets!  Ahh. Fine! With my new money finder... Who needs ya?!  Ahh. I was about to close up shop anyways.
Close up! Come on, Gar. You're coming with me.
You aren't taking him anywhere yet. You haven't greased the fryer yet.  Don't worry about Jerry. I'll make sure he gets his nightly craw.
Gary.
Heh, heh. Excuse me mam.
Dirty money spends just like the clean.
I've finished greasing the fryer.
You sure make easy work.
Try telling that to my frizzled hands.
Yeah, but you still have work to do.
I do?
Yeah. How about you rearrange the wall rivets from smallest to largest?
But aren't they the same size.
That's what they want you to know. Now take a long look.
Will do, captain.
Now back to our treasure hunt. Eh, boy.
Meow.
You okay, boy?
Meow.
That a boy.
Mr. Krabs is right. Some of these rivets are off by as much as five nanometers. Well, I better get to work.
Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey. There's no stopping. There's a laundromat that needs to be cleaned out. Arr, arr, arr, arr, arr, arr, arr. Cleaned out. Get it. Ahh. Never mind. MUSH!
Meow.
If you don't get moving I'm gonna'...
You're gonna' do what sir?
I'm gonna' give him a snaily treat.
Meow.
Ohh, okay. The rivets are all rearranged.
What!? How is that possible? Uhh, now I want you to paint the Krusty Krab.
Okay. That's easy.
Uh, uh, uh, but I want you to do it with this toothbrush.
Okay. Bye old pal.
Meow.
Oh, no, no, no. Don't worry about Terry. He's in good claws.
I'm sure he is. Bye.
Now little sneagle. Ready to do some laundry? Arr, arr, arr, arr, arr, arr.
Hee, hee, hee, hee, hee, hee.
Hey, where's my change?
Hee, hee, hee, hee.
Well, that stinks.
Arr, arr, arr. I guess he didn't see that coming.  Hey, what's the big ide-er? We've just found a pot at the end of the rainbow. Aieeeee!
What the?
It's like taking candy from a baby!
And that old whip shhhhooo the coins just flew from the machine!
Ahh, don't worry. We'll get to the bottom of this.
Uh oh. Pronto. Time for plan B!
Ah ha! That should do it!  Ahh. Time to check in with Mr. Krabs to see if he needs me to do anymore impossible jobs.
I'm never gonna' hear the end of this one when I get home.
Pardon me sir. You haven't seen a crab walking around with a snail, have you?
Neptune jerks. One's a criminal used a snail to swipe the coins from me. Those steamin' crustation used his sneagle to swipe coins from me.
His sneagle?
Thats right. What's the steaming might to show. Just walk right past him.
Arr, arr, arr, arr.
Mr. Krabs. What have you done to my Gary? So this is what a hotbed of sin looks like...
Arr, arr, arr, arr. How's it going boyo? Are you feeling the coin vibes?
Pu, pu, pow.
What do you mean you don't feel so good?
Meoow.
You look fine to me. Now stop being such a baby and make me some money. Excuse me, pregnant lady coming through!  Uh, he he. Hoo boy. It--it's sure hard being preggers!
Uh...yeah.
Ooh!
Get ready for it now, boy me boy!  Ladies and gentlemen!  Thank you for your money!  Come on Harry! Let's go. Come on you!
Mr. Krabs! For shame!
What do you mean? I'm just showing Rory off.
Don't you lie to me! I know all about you using Gary to steal money!
I got nothing of the soul.  I would never steal. You have to quit making up stories, boy-yo.
I'm not making up anything! I know all about your little scheme! You're the one making up stories!
Don't you have work you should be doing?
Oh, that's rich!
No, if I was rich I wouldn't have to hire the likes of you!
That's hurtful, Mr. Krabs, and you know it!
Why you little yellow... Well, I never...
You never what? Learned to use decent language?
Who do you think you are!  Jackpot! Money, money, money, money. Come to papa.  Oh boy.
Yeah he's in pretty bad shape with the impact of all that metal but he'll pull through.
Doctor? How does this sort of thing happen?
I think this has something to do with it.
Hey, my Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy fridge magnet!
It seems to be your pet swallowed it. It has a very strong magnetic pull.
Cause' it's a magnet! That's it, Mr. Krabs!
Arr, arr, arr, arr. Well, what do ya' know?
Well, there's still the matter of the bill.
What? Oh, I can't afford this.
Actually, you have just enough change to cover it.
Noooooooooooooooo!

Look, another rubber stopper for my rubber stopper collection.  It's a little land that's all mine.  Now it's snowing in my little land.  It's snowing again.  Hey, my little land must be having an earthquake.  Must have been an aftershock.  Uh, hey, no wonder you're angry. You just gotta turn it upside down. See?
Much, much later...
Snow globes are always funny.  Hey, you want to smell my armpit? There you go.

column1: Thanks. Oh, hey, do you like to play tag?  Never played it before, huh? Uh, yeah, it's kinda hard to explain. Oh, how about hide-and-seek?  No, no, no, this one's easy. You just close your eyes while the other guy hides, and then you find him and you win. Okay? Ready, uh, now go hide.  1, 2, 3. You can skip a few, 100. Okay, ready or not, here I come.  Hey, where'd you go? Why are you hiding from me?  This game's harder than I thought.  You want to smell my armpit again?  You win again. Hey, hey, you want to do meet my friend, SpongeBob? Uh, he's a little weird, but you guys will probably get along.  We can play more coral ring toss later.

column2: Dinnertime, Gary. And it's your favorite flavor—crushed anemone byproducts and krill.  What is that horrific banging?  Patrick's being eaten by a giant sea monster!
Hey, hey!
Oh, he's crying out for help.
Hey, SpongeBob! Hey, up here! Look, no hands!
Gary, this is even worse than yesterday.
Yesterday...
Excuse me, I think your ice machine's broken.
Keep looking. You'll find someone who cares.
Uh, you're the owner here, aren't you?
That would be me.
Well, I think your ice machine might be broken.
Oh, try telling that guy over there.
Excuse me, the ice machine's broken.
No! Why?! Why?! Why?!  Why?!  It was horrible.  Patrick! Patrick!
SpongeBob!
I must've been daydreaming. I saw you in this big monster's dripping maw, and I thought you were being eaten.
Uh, I wasn't being eaten. That monster is my friend. I thought you might like to meet him.
